channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NE
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NE

item.title: Report E-2025050187
item.description:
Report E-2025050187

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-07
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 7, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of hydrogen peroxide was damaged by a faulty skid and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025050425
item.description:
Report X-2025050425

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-05
  • City: LINCOLN
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Beth Wilson, SCM, called Safety to report a spill in trailer 89203 of UN1814, POTASSIUM HYDROXIDE, SOLUTION, 8, PG II, BULK PKG (Tote). Beth stated it looked to be 8 oz of the product spilled onto the trailer floor when the forklift operator struck the top of the tote with the forks on the forklift while unloading other freight in the trailer. Beth stated the tote is not actively spilling and the spill is contained to the trailer in dock door 21. Cura was called to assist in a tote transfer and to clean the trailer floor.

item.title: Report X-2025050500
item.description:
Report X-2025050500

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-02
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO THREE AIR PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY TWO KILOGRAMS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBERS TO CONSIGNEES IN THE USA ARE 1ZG188J40114945013 AND 1ZG188J40121994279.

item.title: Report X-2025050648
item.description:
Report X-2025050648

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-10T03:46:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-29
  • City: OMAHA
  • State: NE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A FOLGERS CLASSIC ROAST BOX CAME THROUGH LEAKING WHAT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE SULFURIC ACID FROM A CAT WET BATTERY. THE FOREARM OF THE EMPLOYEE WAS EXPOSED. EMPLOYEE PLACED THE AFFECTED AREA UNDER RUNNING COOL WATER AND MONITORED FOR ANY POSSIBLE BURNS. THERE WERE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.
